clues.text: This Chicago man's operation had $100 million in annual revenue; in 2020s instead of 1920s dollars, that's about $1.8 billion
In 1992 this ex-leader of Panama was convicted of cocaine trafficking, among other things
It's the last name of Massachusetts crime boss Whitey & his brother William, a long-serving president of the state senate
One of Time's "Top 10 Real-Life Mob Bosses", this 1980s Medellín cartel man was said to burn $2 million to stay warm when on the run
Vincent Gigante long feigned insanity, walking NYC in his pajamas & earning this mafia-related nickname; lose the opening "G" sound
With Low Country ingenuity, in 1932 the Dutch built a 20-mile-long one of these to cut off the Zuider Zee & create a whole new province
The lower California peninsula also goes by this other name
The "lower 48" refers to U.S. states that are this, a 10-letter word meaning "in contact"
This body of water, the lowest point on Earth, is part of a rift valley formed by lowering of the Earth's crust, not by erosion
In Scotland, the Lowlands can refer to the valley lying in the basins between the River Forth & this other river to the south
This North Carolina capital was named in honor of a noted explorer in 1792
Named for Mahatma, Gandhinagar is home to 300,000 & the capital of Gujarat State in this country
It didn't work out for this king with the American Revolution, but they named a town & nearby peak for him in South Africa
In 1954 a New Jersey township voted to reject "Nixon" & renamed itself after this inventor
Shahr means "city" & after 1979's Iranian revolution, a place was redubbed this last name "Shahr" to honor the new leader
This word suitably introduces us to the fictional Mrs. Maisel & the very real boxing legend Marvin Hagler
A spreadsheet program that launched in 1985, or a verb meaning "to surpass"
The Latin for "price" gives us this word that is perfectly fine in front of "gems" & "metals"
It's a good name for a 350-mile-long lake or the head of a convent
Whether describing silver or the British pound, this 8-letter word really is great

Tom Petty:
"It's Good To Be ____"

A 1996 Jay-Z single:
"Dead ____"

Stevie Wonder:
"Sir ____"

Spin Doctors:
"Two ____"

The Who:
"The Acid ____"
Playing Malorie in "Bird Box", this actress puts blindfolds on 2 kids, warning them not to take them off
One myth says the seer Tiresias was blinded by this Greek goddess of wisdom after seeing her nude
Michonne dealt with The Governor in a stabby way on this show; he'd later sport an eyepatch
One of this conniving group, Delilah alerts them that Samson is finally at their mercy; next comes some gouging
In "King Lear" a bloodthirsty Regan demands that this man be hanged while Goneril screams, "Pluck out his eyes"
A measurement of distance, not time, it's equal to about 6 trillion miles, you know, give or take
The troposphere is sandwiched between the earth & this next layer of the atmosphere
Let's change the subject & talk about this class of rocks including gneiss & soapstone that gets changed atom by atom over time
The size of a fist, this organ behind your left ribs fights invading germs in your blood by producing lymphocytes
This Greek gave his name to the law that says a body in fluid is acted on by force proportional to how much fluid it displaces
This company that offers tax preparation services is named for its founders, brothers Henry & Richard
Its name goes back to its founding in 1920 as the Queensland & Northern Territory Aerial Services
Truth be told, the first part of this telecommunications company's name comes from the Latin word for truth or certainty
The name of this tech company is a shortening of the metropolis where it was founded by 2 Stanford computer scientists in 1984
GEICO's name goes back to its original customer base, military personnel & these people, the G-E
Coach Taylor moves from the East Dillon Lions to Philadelphia's Pemberton Pioneers in the finale of this series
"It really seemed like Pied Piper was going to work", said Bill Gates in a cameo as this series wrapped
The last episode of "This is Us" included the funeral of Rebecca, played by her
Drug cocktails & the other kind of cocktails were both featured in the finale of this show starring Billy Porter
When this show ended on April 10, 2022, one of the 2 female leads was dead. Which? Well, the show didn't live up to its title

rounds.comments: (Ken: Our clue will lead you to a 4-letter word but you'll have to give us the two states whose postal codes combine to form that 4-letter word.)

clues.text: A wizard's magic rod
Firstborn of Genesis 4:1
A mark left on the skin after a wound has healed
Molten rock that reaches the surface
A sheet of glass set into a window or door
This noted astronomer's lists of works include "Comet", "Contact" & "Cosmos"
This Mark Twain novel starts a few days before the death of Henry VIII
H.H. Munro got his pen name, Sake, from this Persian collection of quatrains
Nathan Zuckerman appears in the 6th of his novels starting with "My Life as a Man" through "The Counterlife"
This Belgian-born French novelist wrote over 200 novels, many about Inspector Maigret
Washington Irving said it was the "renowned & ancient city of Gotham
William Cooper Brand wrote this city "runs to brains as well as to bread and baked beans"
Carl Sandburg called it "Stormy, husky, brawling, City of the Big Shoulders"
"They got some crazy little women there and I'm gonna get me one"
"North Beach to Tenderloin, over Russian Hill, The grades are something giddy, and the curves are fit to kill!"

rounds.text: He debuted on TV in 1967; the show's creator wanted someone from behind the Iron Curtain to be on "our side"
